item.title: Mahalo and Farewell
item.description:
To exist is to change, to change is to mature, to mature is to go on creating oneself endlessly. - Henri Bergson

Hi there, folks üëãüèº

In the past years I have been improving my software skills working in many environments, from big corporations to small startups. And with seniority, I have been spending most of my time on complex and private projects. At this point it's clear for me that it's time to say goodbye to chmod a+x singularity.

But it's fun to look back and think about our journeys!

I started this website in 2014 when I was about to graduate from my Ph.D. in Physics in Stony Brook. Those were the days when I was so so thirsty about learning everything about computers! I wrote an entire book on Python & Algorithms, and I was playing CTF intensively and top 30 at CTFTimes.org. I had that üî• to learn everything and write about everything (hence the variety of topics that this blog has üòÖ).

Creating nerdy websites has been a trend in my life. I wrote my first (Flash) website when I was 11:

Funny how I had texts on AI and C++ and Java back then... Certain things don't change (but MP3s do ü§£).

Then I created another website when I was in college:

And then when I was in my Ph.D. (so many papers in this one!).

Finally, I wrote singularity.sh, and I feel like my journey has ended with style üëæ.

Thank you all for following my work, for reading my posts, and for cheering my story. It has been an honor to be here.

Ô∏è- Ô∏è ‚ô•Ô∏è Mia or Marina or bt3gl or bt3 or bytegirl ‚ô•Ô∏è

Ps: In case you already miss me, here a list of posts that I had the most fun writing:

  • Introducing Amigo, a tool to manage Google Cloud Platform Security.
  • Wireshark for fun or profit.
  • The Ultimate Linux Guide for Hackers.
  • The effects of Convolutional Neural Networks on a Hot Summer Night.
  • Introducing Threat Intel.
  • A Tor Proxy in a Raspberry Pi.
  • Ouroboros Statement.
  • Black Hat Python: Infinite possibilities with the Scapy Module.
  • Black Hat Python: Building a UDP Scanner.
  • Understanding the Shellshock Vulnerability.
  • Stripe's First CTF.
  • Lots of Astrophysics for You.
  • Exploiting the Web in 20 Lessons.
  • Smashing the Stack for Fun or WarGames.
item.dc:creator: Mia Steinkirch
